tweets.text:
England could face #WaterShortages due to #ClimateChange and population growth by 2050.

We're securing future water supplies through our National Framework for Water Resources.

Join us, and help save water: https://t.co/m854sW9XCX

#WorldWaterDay #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/dEsY9kqDoq

Natural Flood Management (NFM) projects store & slow the rate water runs into rivers, reducing flood risk downstream. 

We‚Äôre working with landowners to identify opportunities where NFM measures can be delivered on the River Kent in #Kendal 

Details ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/C58pigHLCG https://t.co/Y7Pt8BpeH0

urls.title: Corby man jailed and facing costs of ¬£750,000 for waste crime
urls.description: A Northamptonshire man, who was jailed in January, after a decade of waste offences was ordered this week to pay ¬£12,500 in costs and ¬£140 in victim surcharge.

tweets.text:
Burning, burying and stockpiling waste without the correct permit is #illegal‚ö†Ô∏è

A Northamptonshire man was fined ¬£12,500 and jailed for breaching many environmental laws.

If you suspect any illegal waste activity call: 0800 80 70 60

More info: https://t.co/cksMMi14Qt https://t.co/lPH0BW1iJL

Are you frightened to open a window @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @BorisJohnson @Keir_Starmer @DefraGovUK ? I am. I want to sleep but my unventilated house is full if stale, eggy, toxic, air because of the stench from Walleys Landfill and outside the air is poison. #stopthestink

Do you know @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL @NewsNBC @SimonTagg The level of Stench tonight across the Town is OFF the scale! I am sick. People are plugging up key holes. The Walleys Landfill scandal is SHAMEFUL. @BorisJohnson PLEASE ACT !!!

No ventilation in our home for two weeks at least thanks to #WalleysLandfill Stench. Anyone going to explain that to  @BorisJohnson during a COVID epidemic ? SHAMEFUL @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @NewsNBC @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg #Stopthestink

tweets.text: Looking back...this time in 2017 we removed a weir on the Trent at Bucknall Park with partners @EnvAgencyMids and @TrentCaba. The weir was stopping fish from moving through the river. Three years on, this stretch is a much better home for trout, bullhead and other river wildlife. https://t.co/RgEF72fxDy
